Description: Quite small, complete scarab, made of steatite. Some details carved, whitish-grey colour with incised lines. The division between elytra and prothorax is indicated by an incised line, as is the suture. Both humeral callosities are shown by a short vertical line on the right and a skew line on the left. Head, eyes, clypeus and plates are shown, clypeus with 4 lobes preserved. The side shows two legs each in relief, no hairs indicated, on top of a base line that is only separated partly from the legs. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base. Three hieroglyphic signs in a column: Mn-khpr-ra Medium quality. Perforation along its longitudinal side, slightly askew in the lower part.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2, AA(d), below III floor
